question_content.barrons:question: Appalled by the confused jumble of laws he had inherited from his predecessors, King Joseph II attempted to codify the existing (i)________ of medieval law into a modern and (ii)_______ code.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
welter; consistent.

The key phrase here is confused jumble. A welter is a confused mass or muddle, in other words, a jumble. The king was attempting to take this jumble of miscellaneous laws and turn it into something consistent (coherent; not self-contradictory).

Dearth is incorrect. The key phrase here is confused jumble. A dearth is a lack or scarcity. It makes no sense in the context.

Intransigence is incorrect. The key phrase here is confused jumble. Intransigence means stubbornness or extreme firmness. It makes no sense in the context.

Idiosyncratic is incorrect. The key phrase here is confused jumble. The king was attempting to turn a jumble of miscellaneous laws into an orderly legal code. The adjective idiosyncratic means quirky or individually peculiar. It makes no sense in the context.

Draconian is incorrect. The key phrase here is confused jumble. The king was attempting to turn a jumble of miscellaneous laws into an orderly legal code. The adjective draconian means harsh or unusually severe. It makes no sense in the context.
